definition: Xie Lingyun (385-433) poet during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie
quick/alert/efficacious/effective/to come true/spirit/departed soul/coffin
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate

sentences.english: Xie Lingyun and Xie Yao are the outstanding poets of landscape in the history of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 谢灵运和谢胱是中国诗歌史上的山水诗大家。

sentences.english: As we know, Shan-shui poems were the great achievements of the literary writings of Ling-yun Hsieh.
sentences.chinese: 山水诗可说是谢灵运文学上最重要的成就。

sentences.english: Second, Xie Lingyun bestows on basic subject and emotion connotation.
sentences.chinese: 谢灵运赋的基本主题及情感内涵。

sentences.english: The gifted scholar in Liuchao(Six Dynasties), Xie Lingyun, was influenced deeply by it.
sentences.chinese: 六朝才子谢灵运就深受其影响。

sentences.english: Xie Lingyun is an important poet in the ancient history of Chinese poem.
sentences.chinese: 谢灵运是中国古代诗歌史上的重要人物。

definition: Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
Huan Xuan (369-404), general involved in the break-up of Eastern Jin
Tao Qian or Tao Yuanming 陶淵明|陶渊明 (c. 365-427), Jin dynasty writer and poet

Guangling district of Yangzhou city 揚州市|扬州市[Yang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu

two-character surname Gongsun

Sun Wu, also known as Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Daoist immortal/celestial being
